Math Overview

Scientific Notation

What is the mass of an object that contains three hundred-thousand-billion-billion atoms of carbon. Given that one carbon atom has a mass of twenty billion-billion-billionths of a kilogram?

\[\begin{align*} M&=N_\text{atoms}\times m_\text{C} \\ &=300,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 \times \\ & \qquad 0.000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,02\,\text{kg} \\ &=\big(3E23\big)\big(2E-26\big)\text{kg}\\ &=\big(3\times 2\big)\big(10^{23}\times10^{-26}\big)\,\text{kg}\\ &=6\times10^{23-26}\,\text{kg} \\ &=6E-3\,\text{kg} \\ &=6\,\text{grams} \end{align*}\]

Scientific Notation: More Examples

Scientific Notation: You Try

Question: Simplify \(\dfrac{8\times10^{1024}}{4\times10^{1020}}\times0.5\times10^{-3}\)

\[\begin{align} &=\frac{8}{4}10^{1024-1020}\times\frac{1}{2}10^{-3} \\ &=\frac{8}{4\times2}10^4\times10^{-3}\\ &=\frac{8}{8}10^{4-3}\\ &=1\times10^1\\ &=10 \end{align}\]

Proportionality

An object’s acceleration is proportional to the force on it.

  • 5kg mass pushed at 10N accelerates at 2m/s\(^2\)
  • 5kg mass pushed at 20N accelerates at 4m/s\(^2\)

\[a=\frac{F}{m}\]

Time to travel a distance is inversely proportional to speed

  • Traveling 20 miles at 30 mph takes 40 minutes
  • Traveling 20 miles at 60 mph takes 20 minutes

\[t\propto\frac{1}{v}\]

Geometry

Circle

Sphere

Trigonometry

The math of right triangles!

\[\begin{gather*} \text{SOH-CAH-TOA} \\ \sin\theta=\frac{\text{opposite}}{\text{hypotenuse}}=\frac{b}{c} \\ \cos\theta=\frac{\text{adjacent}}{\text{hypotenuse}}=\frac{a}{c} \\ \tan\theta=\frac{\text{opposite}}{\text{adjacent}}=\frac{b}{a} \end{gather*}\]

Pythagoras’ Theorem: \(a^2 + b^2 = c^2\)

Logarithms

Logarithm is the inverse of exponentiation

Logs can simplify difficult calculations

\[ 278\cdot 316 \quad \text{vs} \quad \log(278\cdot 316) = \log(278) +\log(316) \]

Astronomers invented logarithms to make their lives easier!
